name: Avoid using copyStr and compareStr functions (EGL)
description: This rule searches for all the programs using copyStr and compareStr functions.
output: This report provides the following information: Function full name, Count of copySTR abd compareStr functions
rationale:
Expensive operations compared to substring and concatenation operator for CHAR data types and NUM datatypes.  Some concatenation operations like CHAR and PACK/DECIMAL will require string processing vs CHAR processing (see item above for cost). 
Comments are generated into the COBOL program indicating which statements cause String processing to occur (in a performance considerations section in the initial comments).
reference: EGL Best Practices: Coding For Performance. November 10, 2009. Edition 2
remediation: Try to reduce the use of copyStr and compareStr
alternativeName: Avoid using copyStr and compareStr functions (EGL)

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - Memory, Network and Disk Space Management
